originalTitle: Ex-Nigeria oil minister in bribery trial spent £2m at Harrods, court hears
title: Ex-Nigeria oil minister in bribery trial spent £2m at Harrods, court hears
content: Diezani Alison-Madueke is accused of accepting bribes from industry figures interested in Nigerian government contracts, a court in London has heard.

title: Rwanda takes legal action against UK over axed migrant deal
content: The African nation argues it is owed payments but Downing Street says it will fight the case.

originalTitle: Nigeria president 'in great shape' after falling at Turkey reception
title: Nigeria president 'in great shape' after falling at Turkey reception
content: On a visit to Ankara, Bola Tinubu was filmed stumbling and falling after walking past soldiers and dignitaries.

originalTitle: Trump says US will end support for Iraq if al-Maliki reinstated as PM
title: Big News from Far Away: Who Will Lead Iraq?
content:
Hello, Wonderful World!

Hello, my fantastic friends! It’s your kid-friendly news reporter here, bringing you exciting stories from all over our amazing planet! Today, we’re going on a little trip to a country very, very far away from Africa. It’s a place called Iraq. You might have heard about it! Sometimes, countries need to choose new leaders. It’s a very important job, like choosing a new head teacher for your school. Everyone hopes they choose someone who will help make things better for everyone.

Meet Iraq: A Country Far Away

Iraq is a big country in a part of the world called Asia. It has a lot of history, ancient cities, and kind people. Just like our countries in Africa, Iraq needs good leaders to help everyone live safely and happily. They have schools, hospitals, and busy markets, just like we do! And right now, the people in Iraq are trying to decide who their new main leader will be. It’s a very important choice for their future. Did you know? The capital city of Iraq is called Baghdad! It's one of the oldest and most famous cities in the world.

What is a Prime Minister?

Every country has a leader. In some countries, they are called a President. In other countries, they are called a King or Queen. In Iraq, their main leader is called a Prime Minister. The Prime Minister is like the head of a very big family, which is the whole country! They make big decisions about schools, hospitals, roads, and how the country works with other countries. It’s a big, big job! Did you know? A Prime Minister works very hard every day to make sure their country is safe and happy, just like your parents or guardians work hard for your family!

Who is Mr. al-Maliki?

Now, there’s a man in Iraq named Mr. Nouri al-Maliki. He was the Prime Minister of Iraq before, a few years ago. He was the leader for a long time, helping to guide the country. Recently, some important people in Iraq thought he might be a good leader again. They are a big group in the government, and they said, "We want Mr. al-Maliki to be our Prime Minister!" Did you know? When a group of people in a country's government chooses someone they want to be the leader, it's called 'nominating' them! It's like when your class nominates someone to be the class monitor.

Who is Mr. Trump?

Now, let’s talk about another very important person from a country far, far away. This is Mr. Donald Trump. He used to be the leader of America, also known as the United States. America is a huge country. Mr. Trump, as the leader, would often talk to leaders from other countries, like Iraq. Countries often help each other out, like friends helping each other in a game. Did you know? America is a super big country, and its capital city is Washington, D.C.! It's very different from Baghdad, but both are important cities.

What Does “Helping” Mean?

So, what does it mean when one country helps another? Well, it can mean many things! Sometimes, America gives money to Iraq to help build new schools or hospitals. Sometimes, they help train soldiers to keep everyone safe. They might also send tools, like special vehicles or equipment, to help Iraq deal with challenges. It's like when an older brother or sister helps their younger sibling with homework or protects them from bullies. It's a way of showing friendship and support. Did you know? Countries often work together on big problems like keeping the peace, fighting diseases, or even sharing knowledge about farming to grow more food!

Why Might Help Stop?

Here’s where it gets a bit tricky. Mr. Trump said something important. He said that if Mr. al-Maliki becomes the leader of Iraq again, America might stop helping Iraq in the same way. This means less money, less training, and less of the other help they give. Why would Mr. Trump say this? Well, when Mr. al-Maliki was the leader before, some people, including Mr. Trump and others in America, felt that things were not going as well as they hoped in Iraq. They worried that if he became leader again, it might make it harder for countries to work together. Mr. Trump hoped that Iraq would choose a different leader who he felt would make it easier for America and Iraq to be good partners and help each other more effectively. It's like if you had a friend who you found hard to work with on a school project, you might hope for a different partner next time so the project goes smoothly.

What Happens Next?

When big countries talk like this, it’s a very serious matter. The people in Iraq who choose their leader need to think very carefully. They have to decide what is best for their country. Will they choose Mr. al-Maliki? Or will they choose someone else, hoping to keep the help from America? These are big questions that leaders have to answer. It shows us how countries are all connected, like different parts of a big, beautiful puzzle. Did you know? Even though leaders have big disagreements sometimes, they usually try to find a way to talk and solve problems peacefully, just like we should with our friends!

Why This Matters To Us

Even though Iraq and America are far away, this news helps us understand how the world works. It shows us that leaders make very important choices that affect many people. It also shows that countries often depend on each other, just like we depend on our families and friends. Being a good friend and helping others is important, whether it’s in your school, your community, or between big countries. Let’s always hope for leaders who choose peace and work together for a better world for all children, everywhere!
summary: Former US leader Mr. Trump warned that America would stop helping Iraq if Mr. al-Maliki, who was previously Prime Minister, became Iraq's leader again, causing important discussions in Iraq about who their next leader should be.
whyMatters: This story teaches us that leaders make big choices that affect how countries work together and help each other, showing that friendship and good cooperation are important between all countries.

originalTitle: Mexico vows ‘solidarity’ with Cuba after oil shipment cancellation reports
title: Mexico vows ‘solidarity’ with Cuba after oil shipment cancellation reports
content: The president says Mexico's decision 'to sell or give oil to Cuba for humanitarian reasons' was a 'sovereign' one.

title: Conte reunion a sharp reminder of Chelsea's fall

originalTitle: Bayern legend? How Kane is viewed in Germany as contract talks begin
title: Bayern legend? How Kane is viewed in Germany as contract talks begin
content: Harry Kane is entering the final 18 months of his Bayern Munich contract, and the German champions are eager to keep the prolific striker, as German football writer Constantin Eckner explains.

title: Villa sign striker Abraham for £18.25m
content: England striker Tammy Abraham completes an £18.25m return to Aston Villa from Turkish side Besiktas.
